responses.rationale: The segment states a factual percentage of fatalities but uses no high-potency verbs, metaphors, or other alarmist framing language.
The segment describes actions taken ('restricted,' 'detected,' 'testing') but does not use any high-potency verbs or potent metaphors to frame the situation alarmingly.
The segment reports a finding ('announced,' 'had') but does not use any high-potency verbs or potent metaphors to frame the situation alarmingly.
The segment confirms spread and an undercount but uses neutral verbs ('confirmed,' 'spread,' 'worked,' 'had') and no potent metaphors or alarmist framing.
The segment reports a correction of numbers of birds killed, using neutral verbs ('updated,' 'correct,' 'killed') without alarmist framing.
The segment reports a correction of numbers of birds killed, using neutral verbs ('updated,' 'correct,' 'killed') without alarmist framing.
The segment states a factual outcome ('kills') but does not use any high-potency verbs or potent metaphors to frame the situation alarmingly.
The segment states facts about detection and safety but uses no high-potency verbs, metaphors, or other alarmist framing language.
The segment states a factual assessment ('do not present') but uses no high-potency verbs, metaphors, or other alarmist framing language.
The segment describes the virus's presence and circulation using neutral verbs ('found,' 'circulating') without alarmist framing.
The segment reports infection and killing of birds using factual verbs ('infected,' 'forcing,' 'killing') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment reports the number of birds killed using factual verbs ('kill') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment reports the number of birds killed using factual verbs ('kill') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment provides factual information about Iowa's egg production and chicken population using neutral verbs ('is,' 'had') without alarmist framing.
The segment provides factual information about turkey raising using a neutral verb ('raises') without alarmist framing.
The segment reports the location of cases using a neutral verb ('were') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment reports confirmation of the virus using a neutral verb ('confirmed') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment reports confirmed cases using neutral verbs ('shows,' 'confirmed') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
The segment describes the spread of the disease using neutral verbs ('blamed,' 'contaminate') without high-potency or alarmist framing.
